channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOCIALFB-197] User["video_upload_limits"] => Numeric value () out of range of int
item.description:
FacebookTemplate fb = new FacebookTemplate(accessToken);
fb.userOperations().getUserProfile(); =>

item.summary: User["video_upload_limits"] => Numeric value () out of range of int

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Merged pull request. Expect a maintenance release soon.
Luis: If you've not done so already, please take a moment to sign https://support.springsource.com/spring_committer_signup. Thanks

Important:
The Facebook documentation says "unsigned int32", which don't exist in Java.
There are several classes which still use a int in case of a long.

Page.country_page_likes - Page. countryPageLikes
or
User.test_group - User. testGroup

I guess we should improve this to avoid future crashs/issues.

https://developers.facebook.com/bugs/1660757127499390/
